Iâ€™ve been on a bit of a Verhoeven binge since the release of Benedetta last year, devouring in quick succession most of his greatest hits. This was my first early pre-Hollywood, Dutch Verhoeven. I absolutely loved it.You can see a lot of the hallmarks which Verhoeven would revisit and refine in early films: eruptions of sexually charged catholic imagery, hallucinatory visions and dreams, bisexuality, protagonist uncovering plots and schemes which speak of even greater Conspiracies, and the delicious synergiesâ€¦

Gorgeous candlelit saturnalia brimming with joy & darkness. I was expecting a Dickensian Christmas tale grounded in austere realism, but it was soooo much more than that. The supernatural, the inexplicable, the wondrous are all threaded into the narrative delightfully. Top tier family portrait & Christmas movie.
